subject: Re: Swing Testing
msgSnippet: ... I really liked that article.  Personally, I use a combination of the Humble Dialog approach and Jemmy.  I take two passes at the UI.  The first uses the
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bernd" <berndq@g...> wrote:

> Maybe this will help you:
> http://www.objectmentor.com/resources/articles/TheHumbleDialogBox.pdf

I really liked that article. Personally, I use a combination of the
Humble Dialog approach and Jemmy. I take two passes at the UI. The
first uses the Humble Dialog approach and builds a logical UI layer
(which is presentation independant). The secod builds the
presentation/interaction layer. For Swing GUIS I make use of Jemmy.
I'm planning to write this up in a Coad Letter in the not to distant
future.

Dave
